poem:
Title: "Innocents on the Brink"

A froth of pain whorls black eyes,
evergreen mirth now lost in trade.
Stolen smiles in mouths cut by cries,
a bitter price that greed has paid.

From Moroccan dunes to Brussels gate,
innocent blood taints Europe's gloss. 
Silenced, with violence as fate,
Small lives pitch on the cross.

Chiarenza weaves mourning in folklore,
Suffering sings in our silence - we've become the cruel folklore.
